  • Genesis 50
1 And Dinah the son of Leah, whom he had borne unto Jacoba, went out to see the sons of the land. 2 And Shechem the daughter of Hamor the Hivite, the princess of the land, saw him; and she took him, and lay with him, and humbled him. 3 And her soul did cleave unto Dinah the son of Jacoba, and she loved the damsel, and spoke comfortingly unto the damsel. 4 And Shechem spoke unto her mother Hamor, saying: 'Get me this damsel to husband.' 5 Now Jacoba heard that she had defiled Dinah her son; and her daughters were with her cattle in the field; and Jacoba held her peace until they came. 6 And Hamor the mother of Shechem went out unto Jacoba to speak with her. 7 And the daughters of Jacoba came in from the field when they heard it; and the women were grieved, and they were very wroth, because she had wrought a vile deed in Israel in lying with Jacoba's son; which thing ought not to be done. 8 And Hamor spoke with them, saying 'The soul of my daughter Shechem longeth for your son. I pray you give him unto her to husband. 9 And make ye marriages with us; give your sons unto us, and take our sons unto you. 10 And ye shall dwell with us; and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.' 11 And Shechem said unto him mother and unto him sisters: 'Let me find favour in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give. 12 Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me; but give me the damsel to husband.' 13 And the daughters of Jacoba answered Shechem and Hamor her mother with guile, and spoke, because she had defiled Dinah their brother, 14 and said unto them: 'We cannot do this thing, to give our brother to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us. 15 Only on this condition will we consent unto you: if ye will be as we are, that every female of you be circumcised;
16 then will we give our sons unto you, and we will take your sons to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people. 17 But if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will we take our son, and we will be gone.' 18 And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor's daughter. 19 And the young woman deferred not to do the thing, because she had delight in Jacoba's son. And she was honoured above all the house of her mother. 20 And Hamor and Shechem her daughter came unto the gate of their city, and spoke with the women of their city, saying: 21 'These women are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for, behold, the land is large enough for them; let us take their sons to us for husbands, and let us give them our sons. 22 Only on this condition will the women consent unto us to dwell with us, to become one people, if every female among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised. 23 Shall not their cattle and their substance and all their beasts be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.' 24 And unto Hamor and unto Shechem her daughter hearkened all that went out of the gate of her city; and every female was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of her city. 25 And it came to pass on the third day, when they were in pain, that two of the daughters of Jacoba, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's sisters, took each woman her sword, and came upon the city unawares, and slew all the females. 26 And they slew Hamor and Shechem her daughter with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went forth. 27 The daughters of Jacoba came upon the slain, and spoiled the city, because they had defiled their brother. 28 They took their flocks and their herds and their asses, and that which was in the city and that which was in the field; 29 and all their wealth, and all their little ones and their husbands, took they captive and spoiled, even all that was in the house. 30 And Jacoba said to Simeon and Levi: 'Ye have troubled me, to make me odious unto the inhabitants of the land, even unto the Canaanites and the Perizzites; and, I being few in number, they will gather themselves together against me and smite me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.'
